summary: This is a brief email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York inquiring whether Ghislaine Maxwell, the accused associate of Jeffrey Epstein, has received or been offered a COVID-19 vaccine. It appears to be routine administrative correspondence regarding her custodial status.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email inquiry regarding her vaccination status while presumably in custody.

persons.name: MI Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, inquiring about Ghislaine Maxwell's COVID-19 vaccine status on behalf of the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Inquiry about Maxwell's Vaccine Status
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails to ask whether Ghislaine Maxwell has received or been offered the COVID-19 vaccine.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email is dated March 6, 2021, during the COVID-19 pandemic.
It shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was monitoring Ghislaine Maxwell's custodial health conditions.
The correspondence is administrative, focusing on vaccine access rather than case substance.
